meanings.definition: To surpass in handling or managing
meanings.sent1: She outhandled all her competitors in the cooking competition.
meanings.sent2: The experienced chef outhandled the new trainee in the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The cat outhandled the mouse in catching the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: His quick thinking outhandled any potential problems that arose.
meanings.sent5: The skilled juggler outhandled the difficult routine flawlessly.

meanings.definition: To outdo in skill or ability in handling
meanings.sent1: He outhandled his opponent in the chess match.
meanings.sent2: The talented pianist outhandled all other musicians in the concert.
meanings.sent3: The clever squirrel outhandled the bird in finding hidden nuts.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity outhandled any obstacles in her artistic projects.
meanings.sent5: The determined athlete outhandled the challenging obstacle course with ease.

meanings.definition: To outperform in managing or dealing with something
meanings.sent1: The team outhandled their rivals in the final game of the season.
meanings.sent2: The skilled negotiator outhandled the difficult client's demands.
meanings.sent3: The superhero outhandled the villain's evil plans with ease.
meanings.sent4: Her positivity outhandled any negativity that came her way.
meanings.sent5: The efficient manager outhandled the project timeline successfully.
